Detailed Description

Base class for all material/surface types.

DzMaterial::DzMaterial ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

DzMaterial::bakedMapChanged (  )  [signal]

Transmitted when the baked map of this material changes.

void DzMaterial::enablePropagateRenderPriorityToNodes ( bool  propagateOnOff  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets whether or not this material should propagate its render priority up to all the nodes that use it. Setting this to true will also ensure that the render priority is set for nodes that the material is assigned to at a later time.

The default behaviour is to not propagate.

Parameters:
propagateOnOff Whether or not the new priority value should be applied to all nodes that use this material (this will include the top-level skeleton node when dealing with figures).
DzUVSet * DzMaterial::getActiveUVSet ( const DzGeometry *  geom  )  const
Returns:
The uv set that is used by this material for the given geometry. May be NULL if the geometry does not have any UV Sets.
DzUVSet * DzMaterial::getActiveUVSet ( DzShape *  shape  )  const
Returns:
The uv set that is used by this material for the given shape. May be NULL if the shape does not have any UV Sets.

See also:
needsTangentSpaceParams()

Overriden by derived classes to indicate if they needs the additional dPds and dPdsM parameters

Returns:
Should this material should always embed into a DSON scene.

Overriden by derived classes to indicate if they should always be embedded in the scene.

Collects all the images that are being used by this material at the current time and inserts them into the given list if they are not already there.

Returns:

DzRenderMgr::RenderPriority DzMaterial::getRenderPriority (  )  const [virtual, slot]

Render priority controls the order in which materials are handled during a render. The higher the priority, the earlier the material will be handled. If several materials have the same render priority, those materials will be handled in an arbitrary order.

The default render priority is RENDER_PRIORITY_NORMAL.

Returns:
The render priority for this material.
DzEnumProperty * DzMaterial::getRenderPriorityControl (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
A pointer to the property that controls the render priority for this material.
QObjectList DzMaterial::getShapeList (  )  const [slot]

This function is mainly provided for DAZ Script access. It is recommended that plug-in developers use the much more efficient shapeListIterator() method instead.

Returns:
A list of the shapes this material is on.

bool DzMaterial::isOpaque (  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]

Overriden by derived classes to indicate if they are opaque shader types (i.e. can be drawn first in OpenGL). If not opaque, then objects that use this material will need to be sorted back to front.

Reimplemented in DzDefaultMaterial.

DzMaterial::selectionStateChanged ( DzMaterial *  mat,
bool  onOff 
) [signal]

void DzMaterial::setBakedMap ( DzTexture *  img  )  [virtual, slot]

Set the 'baked' shader map for this material. This overrides any current material settings and just draws the map. This is useful for representing the results of off-line shaders that can not be represented in OpenGL - the results of the shader are 'baked' onto a texture map, and then applied to the material with this function.

Parameters:
img The image that will be applied to the material instead of the current material settings. If NULL, the current baked map is cleared and the material is returned to using its current settings.
void DzMaterial::setBaseOpacity ( float  val  )  [pure virtual, slot]

Set the opacity value for this material.

void DzMaterial::setRender ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings  )  const [virtual]

Parameters:

void DzMaterial::setRenderPriority ( int  priority  )  [slot]

Deprecated.

Use the setRenderPriority() method that takes a DzRenderMgr::RenderPriority as a parameter instead.

void DzMaterial::setRenderPriority ( DzRenderMgr::RenderPriority  priority  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets the render priority for this material. Render priority controls the order in which materials are handled during a render. The higher the priority, the earlier the material will be handled. If several materials have the same render priority, those materials will be handled in an arbitrary order.

The render priority on all nodes that use this material (this will include the top-level skeleton node when dealing with figures) can automatically be set to match the material's new priority by calling enablePropagateRenderPriorityToNodes() with true before calling this method.

The default render priority is RENDER_PRIORITY_NORMAL.

Parameters:
priority The new priority value.
void DzMaterial::setShader ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings  )  const [protected, pure virtual]

Called during the setRender function, child classes need to reimplement this function to set parameters for their specific shader.

Implemented in DzDefaultMaterial.

void DzMaterial::setSmoothingAngle ( float  angle  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets the smoothing angle for the material. This only has effect on the material if smoothing is enabled.

Parameters:
angle The smoothing angle for the material. Any edges on the mesh where angle of the normals of the adjacent facets is less than this value will be smoothed. Higher values mean more smoothing, lower values mean less smoothing.
void DzMaterial::setSmoothingOn ( bool  onOff  )  [virtual, slot]

Sets whether or not smoothing is enabled for the material.

Parameters:
onOff If true, smoothing is applied according to the smoothing angle. If false, no smoothing is applied to the material.
DzMaterial::settingsChanged (  )  [signal]

Transmitted when one of the values of this material changes.

bool DzMaterial::shadersMatch ( const DzMaterial *  otherMat  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if these materials are using the same shaders, false otherwise. Default implementation returns true if the materials are the same class.
DzMaterial::smoothingChanged (  )  [signal]

Transmitted when the smoothing settings of this material change.

void DzMaterial::startDrawHighlight (  )  [slot]

Causes this material to be drawn with a highlight based on the styles current highlight color. This is used by material selection tools, etc, to give visual feedback to the user about a material in the viewport.

void DzMaterial::stopDrawHighlight (  )  [slot]

Causes this material to stop being drawn with a highlight.
